Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: nsahney
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and very comfortable and clean. Lots of closet space. Clean and well laid out kitchen. Would have liked the bed to be more comfortable. The mattress was not very comfortable and the bed creaked when you turned.

Reviews.Title: “suites avenue - lovely stay in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: roxane1974
Reviews.Content: excellent location, friendly front desk, clean and lovely suites! highly recommended to stay in for either a few days or a couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: “I have been a repeat client for 6 years”
Reviews.Author: Jack F
Reviews.Content: great value for the location and the quality. The Reception personal are absoultly professional, ready to assist you for all your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay at Suites Evenue”
Reviews.Author: liran777
Reviews.Content: We arrived on April-8 for 1 week. Had the standard family apartment (#31) which was very good for our needs. The apartment is ~60sqmr and has nice appliances in it such as oven+microwave, espresson machine and washing machine. The cleaning service was very good and the apartment was well oragnized every day. The location is very nice, at the heart of Pg de Garcia across the street from famous Casa Mille building. From the roof of the hotel (floor 9) you have great view of Barcelona, small swiming pool and some chairs to relax. The nearest metro is diagonal station which is about 200m from the hotel. The only thing that was a bit inconvinient for us was that the apartment was ready for us at 4pm instead of 2pm. I understand that this is not a common case.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Minor things to note. Beware of taxi rip-offs.”
Reviews.Author: ViVaCeAA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 26, which has 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. The Suites Avenue has a fantastic location on Passeig de Gracia - in the middle of the action and across the street from the Pedrera. In our room the master suite had a huge bedroom and bathroom with tub, shower, toilet and bidet. However it had no door separating the bathroom and the bedroom and so it is unsuitable for anyone but a couple or a single person. The other bedroom had a tiny single mattress and a rather tight bathroom. The kitchen was small but serviceable. Whoever thought of putting the dishwasher right in the way of the sink probably never did any dishes in his life. We wanted this room because as a family, having 2 bathrooms was a necessity. Unfortunately our lower floor meant we felt rumbling every time the metro passed underneath. I would definitely recommend a higher floor if possible. While it didn't bother me it could be bad for a light sleeper. The apartment was very modern and clean - I had no complaints except the handles to cabinets and closets were difficult to grasp and more stylish than practical. We appreciated the laundry and the dishwasher greatly and took advantage of the opportunity to eat in. The amenities are great too. There's a great rooftop deck with a pool and a lower pool for lap swimmers though it was too cool to swim while I was there. Internet was good although there was only one ethernet jack in the whole unit which was slightly inconvenient. Overall I was pleased with my stay although the checkout process was annoying - really why was the inspection needed? During checkout the clerk was very concerned about the piece of glass under the tv in the living room and told me it was worth 400 Euros. It was a minor annoyance given the quality of the stay. I'd definitely recommend this for families and people who want to have an option to eating in. Beware of the taxi cabs that are parked outside the hotel. 3 out of 4 times we hailed a taxi the driver tried to tack on a "supplemental" charge although we were not going to the airport, port, train station or convention center, nor did we have any luggage - which are the only instances where extra charges are allowed. If a cabbie tries to pull this stunt point to the taxi charge table that is posted in the car and ask "por que?". Unfortunately we didn't know how to handle this "tourist tax" until our last day but maybe someone will learn from our mistakes. We got overcharged twice this way and the third time I asked them to reverse the charge.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Laura K
Reviews.Content: suites Avenue was a great choice. The location was ideal, in the heart of L'Exaimple right across from Gaudi's La Pedrera, with taxis, buses and the subway at our fingertips. We drove from Geneva and parked our car in the hotel garage for 27 euro a day (we were able to park right on the street in front of the hotel for free on Sunday and Easter Monday). the suite was excellently furnished and beautifully maintained. Sitting on our terrace overlooking the interior courtyard was a great way to start or finish the day. highly recommend to all. And the staff was great

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LM631
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel in a great location in Barcelona - it is a self-contained apartment block, very modern decor but also v comfortable (full-sized fridge, dishwasher, cleaning service every day, great little gym, roof pool/terrace - note that the pool is small, ie not a lap pool, v comfortable bed). My only slight complaint is that my room was a little noisy - mainly due to someone knocking on my neighbour's door every morning at 8 am (too early for holidays!) which woke me up, but I'm quite a light sleeper. I stayed there with my sister, her husband and their 2 year old (they had a separate room, with its own baby cot), and we all had a great time. Very friendly staff also. And it felt extremely safe (you have to get buzzed in from the street).

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, contemporary, new, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tempas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our stay. We had a two bedroom apartment with kitchen, laundry, lots of storage, living/dining area, balcony, it was very spacious. Fantastic view of Passeig de Gracia. Two pools, small fitness center, internet is free if you are connected via ethernet cord. Plenty of little markets nearby to have some snacks on hand. Staff was so nice and helpful. So many restaurants and cafe's plus close to 2 metro stops. Only issue is the hotel is all stone so voices echo through the halls, staff should ask guests to be more quiet in common areas.

Reviews.Title: “We are coming back!”
Reviews.Author: TravelpeopleMiami
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with children this is a great place! The location is excellent, right across from the touristic bus, walking distance to the center, La Rambla, and Gothic Quarter. There is a 24 hours pharmacy across from the hotel. A small supermarket and restaurants are very close. The staff was very helpful and kind. We had a problem with noise coming from construction from another building, the staff was understanding and changed us to another room promptly. I was so impressed! They really went above and beyond our expectations. We would be happy to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, ideal for families”
Reviews.Author: Julie F
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon Suites Avenue online when searching for a hotel with cooking facilities and space for one mother and two children. Suites Avenue surpassed my expectations. We were stunned when we walked into the apartment to see the perfect view of Gaudi's La Pedrera. The location is ideal and the apartment was spacious and stylish. We had two bedrooms and two bathrooms, a sitting area and the kitchen was very well-equipped for our needs. I was surprised to find both a dishwasher and a washing machine. Passeig de Gracia could be compared London's Regent Street; it's central but not crazy busy. The metro station Diagonal is half a block away and we used the metro a lot to get around, though we could also walk to all the central locations. It was cool to have people taking pictures of our hotel as being of architectural interest! The front desk is manned 24 hours a day which was really comforting, and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. There are two small and very stylish pools but unfortunately it wasn't quite hot enough for us to use them in March. The only criticism I have is that the free wifi service wasn't great, but better service would have been available had I been willing to pay for it! We did hear noises at night because the rooms are located around a central atrium, but it didn't bother us or stop us from sleeping. On our last day, we woke up to the sounds of the Barcelona marathon running right past our window which was lots of fun to watch. I would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to anyone traveling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “SUITES AVENUE. SECOND VISIT!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea B
Reviews.Content: March 2012.The second time we have stayed at Suites Avenue (previous time was Sept 2009). First time we stayed here as a couple then came back second time with our 19month old daughter. Great place to stay with a child as lots of space to move around and v useful to have kitchen and fridge. A cot was made up for our child on arrival with v good quality bedding. Our bed was also v comfortable. Excellent value for money, excellent location and great service. Near to many really good bars and restaurants (not much opportunity to go to them though with a child in tow!).Had large double bedroom, large en suite bathroom, single bedroom and shower room, living room, kitchen area and balcony. Immaculately clean on arrival with mini bar stocked with various booze and soft drinks. Apartment cleaned every day. I would really recommend these apartments and will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Architectural Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Mjc2012
Reviews.Content: We found Suites from friends who stayed ther last summer. What would we do without friends! Awesome accommodations, immaculate! The view was breathtaking! The staff at Suites were very accommodating their suggestions for touring and dinner were excellent. We wish we could have stayed longer. It was like home away from home. I will recommend Suites to anyone I know traveling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Competitive Luxury”
Reviews.Author: ronacom13
Reviews.Content: We were planning to rent an apartment for a week in Barcelona. We went back and forth with agents a bit but became concerned when we got a different description of a neighborhood from the agents and from the posts on the Forums. We were about to give up and book a hotel when in some search "Suites Avenue" popped up. It's a silly name, I think, but a wonderful place to stay. The price was competitive with decent apartments and, lo and behold, these are apartments! This is really a residential hotel so don't expect full touristic hotel services but you have your own luxurious apartment, beautifully appointed and spotless. Only one person is at the desk and there is no 'hotel' lobby per se. There is daily maid service included, not the norm in most apartments, and there are washer dryers that came in handy in the middle of our trip (the first week was spent hiking). There is a small but functional gym and one computer for guest's use. The location is central enough to walk to everything and every form of public transportation is steps away from the front door. We will stay there on every subsequent trip to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Call me old-fashioned, but I think the bathroom should have a door...”
Reviews.Author: jinjawitch
Reviews.Content: Actually, Suites Avenue are a great place to stay and we really enjoyed our visit. We had room 72 which was a little smaller than we expected, but it was clean and functional and had a terrific view over the courtyard. It is a rare find to have such a lovely place close to a Gaudi and looking across at Casa Mila from the terrace is a treat. The staff are nice and helpful and the whole building is safe and secure. The only things I didn't like about Suites Avenue are completely subjective so don't let them put you off: I would prefer to be closer to the sea and would chose a hotel near to the front in future. I hated the open plan design of the bathroom and bedroom, but if you don't mind being woken up by your partner using the facilities you'll be fine.... Saying this, I might return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The best possible location. Excellent accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: Innaal
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Suites Avenues 3 times over 1.5 years. Each time it was a long-term stay for almost 3 months. As far as I am concerned, it doesn't get better, especially if you require an accommodation for a longer term. Nevertheless, it is perfectly-suited for a short stay. Excellently sized spacious apartments, very modern, nicely designed, very clean (I am personally very fussy about the cleanness of accommodation). It not common to find a serviced apartment with an everyday cleaning service (in Australia, anyway). Very good, pleasant & very helpful staff. As far as I am concerned, the location can not get better, right in the heart of Barcelona, right opposite to La Pedrera, in the middle of the Passeo de Gracia shopping strip, in close proximity to main sights, fine dining, etc. Highly recommended. Make sure you go upstairs to the rooftop as it opens up an absolutely beautiful perspective/view on Barcelona. The only thing that you should keep in mind that it is still a serviced apartment after all, therefore luggage handling & dining services are not available. However, as with all the cafes & restaurants being all around the place it does not appear to be a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect luxury stay in Barcelona - very central & easy”
Reviews.Author: vivianegalante
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay in Barcelona. Clean, quiet, comfortable beds, next to shops, restaurant, cafeterias, taxi point and buses. We would only appreciate a vending machine selling bottled water on each floor as currying it is very difficult. Otherwise a great stay and staff very helpful and english speaking. Thank you for a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. More than exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: namest
Reviews.Content: Was a bit concerned booking this after reading some mixed reviews. Loved the location. The amenities were perfect for our needs. Had just spent 12 days touring Israel and was delighted to have an apartment to stay in. The washer and dryer were an added bonus. Being from the States it would have been helpful to have had some instructions on use of appliances in English. Would highly recommend staying here. Front desk help was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed again in 2012 - still an excellent place to enjoy Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Serin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Superior Pedrera View apartment in January 2012 and January 2011. Everything was very clean in the apartment, including the kitchen. Tried other hotels in the area (Casa Fuster and Murmuri) but will keep going back to Suites Avenue for the large bedroom, living room, the balcony and beautiful view over La Pedrera and Passeig de Gracia.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: This apartment is a true home away from home. Forget any negative feedback, it is truly a great accommodation option for location, price and quality. It is an aparment Hotel, so therefore you cannot expect the same service and amenities as a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons...however, this will always be my option for staying in Barcelona in the future. I will also try to use this apartment chain in other locations they have accommodation. The location is excellent - walking distance to everything. The service was outstanding - ALL front desk staff were accommodting and helpful. The quality of the finishes are high. Remember however, these are apartments, and typically apartments show a little more wear and tear than Hotel rooms. Access to La Pedrera is literally 30 seconds away, and convenient in order to miss the crowds. I recommend taking "some" minor amenities from home if you are staying for an extended period (dishcloth, dishwasher tablets, plastic bags, etc). One serviced apartment I have stayed at in London do a "Welcome Pack" which includes some basic things you typically need when arriving in a location (bread, milk, mixed salad, pack of pasta, tube of butter, jar of pasta sauce, bottle of wine, bottles of water, juice). This would be a wonderful addition to the property, and could be an option when you book. This is about the only thing I would add or change. Overall, we are completely happy to have stayed at this property and cannot recommend it to others enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Arvivis
Reviews.Content: The location is little bit far from the la rambla's, but really not so far, beside that everything was just perfect - above the expectaions - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: beatrizn1
Reviews.Content: the hotel is incredible close to everything... all the best restaurants, stores and all the most important Gaudi monuments are just a little short walk from the hotel. the rooms also surprised me, they were very big and all extremely confortable and clean

Reviews.Title: “Your Barcelona Base”
Reviews.Author: KAG1948JPN
Reviews.Content: One buys for location location location - one should stay that way as well. Suites Avenue has all the location, style, and comfort one needs for a short or long stay. A friendly competent front desk team is available 24/7. Metro around the corner, and with a taxi stand at door, and cheap, getting around is easy. Many great restaurants (ask the front desk for recommendations) within walking distance - particularly along the street behind, Rambia de Catalana. This is the area where the locals shop and eat - away from the main tourist street. Will be back to Suites Avenue again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent combination of style and location”
Reviews.Author: Shao-Fung Y
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 2 blocks away from the Metro and directly opposite the Casa Mila. There are a number of interesting local shops/arcades around in addition to the luxury boutiques. Lots of interesting tapas bars available all along Passeig de Gracia - take out and eat in to enjoy the excellent facilities. Front desk was helpful everytime and all staff spoke good English. Highly recommended if within your price range.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Consultant7
Reviews.Content: Very nice combination of hotel and apartment. Loved having the kitchen. We had the Penthouse Suite, which was very nice. Very modern, and well maintained. My only complaint is that I asked for an extra sheet and pillow, as my partner likes to fall asleep with the TV and also snores sometimes, so a couple of nights, it was the sofa..but I think they thought we had someone else in the room and would not give us the extra sheets and pillow. I think it was a misunderstanding on why I wanted the sheets. Maybe a language problem.

Reviews.Title: “excellent self catering accomodation”
Reviews.Author: harriet g
Reviews.Content: Super location in the up-market end of Barcelona, which can get a bit seedy down the lower end of the Ramblas. There were lots of restaurants and cafes just one street behind us. Tube handy too but didn't use it as taxis cheap. Apartment was clean and very well appointed, we were even provided with a couple of tablets for the washer dryer. Kitchen had Nespresso machine but no kettle. Lovely bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good for families”
Reviews.Author: Mitzy_1983
Reviews.Content: Best part of this apartment complex is the location. the front desk staff is very helpful and the rooms are spacious and well appointed. it is one of the few places in barcelona where you have two bedrooms and two baths :) two major issues i have are, I was made to wait till 4:30 to check in ( even when the check in time is 2:00pm and we reached the hotel at 12:30 pm due to flight timings. ) Also they take entire stays amount at the check in which is not mentioned anywhere in the booking email. However i would still go back to this place since the location and amenities are fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but maybe find other hotels for next visit.”
Reviews.Author: hinaco
Reviews.Content: Good location - a bus stop for the tour to explore Barcelona, underground stations, fine restaurants are very close to access. Staffs are nice but can not say very nice. €400 as deposit is taken upon check in and some will be deducted unless the kitchen is cleaned and tidy. On the other hand, rooms are not very clean - got dusty on the floor and not wiped/cleaned enough for the table, sofa or bathroom. Please do not forget to pull the blind down in bathroom because it can be visible from lifts by others. Cannot expect better service or hospitality. Maybe find other hotels if we stay just for couple of days next time.

Reviews.Title: “great in all aspects, thank you xavi”
Reviews.Author: zigayer
Reviews.Content: stunning architecture and decor, helpful staff- especially xavi who was very helpful, cleanliness should be improved (gatherings of dust balls in some corners+on bedside lamp, strange smell of bedsheets) although we will be back for location+xavier+artistic architecture, we will bring our own towels and bedsheets next time, adham al toura

Reviews.Title: “Location, Style and Assistance”
Reviews.Author: Bojopark
Reviews.Content: Location-Madison Ave of Barcelona. Central location to EVERYTHING. Style-Modern with touches of Old Spain. Assistance- Nothing was impossible for the group of people at this place...just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Coconita
Reviews.Content: We loved the place and felt at home inmediately. From the decor and location to the excellent attention of the lobby personel , we have received the best value price in a hotel (We are a middle aged couple that travel a lot). The fact that we could prepare our morning coffee, wash our clothes, watch TV in the sitting room while the other is sleeping in the bedroom, and contemplate the Pedrera building from our balcony, makes Suites Avenue the best option in Barcelona for all travelers who appreciate having a fully equiped kitchen, daily cleaning, modern minimalist decoration, location at one of the best avenues in Barcelona, and more space than a hotel room for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, stunning bldg and suite, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: maddieNyc
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom 2 bathroom unit we rented for 5 days (family of 3) faced the Pedrera. Absolutely stunning views. The apt. is well organized, the masterbedroom was ample, the bathrooms were great (adjustable shower head in standing shower, separate tub with hand-held shower head, separate room for toilet and bidet) and the place was spotless. The kitchen was concise but well appointed (washer-dryer combo, dishwasher, wine cooler, fridge, and all the cutlery and plates to be able to eat some meals-in, essential when traveling with kids). The rooftop pool was small but the lounge chairs comfortable with nice views of all of BCN. But one of the best amenities was the friendly staff. In particular, Javier the Concierge was highly informative, attentive, funny, and gave us the best reommendations for food, restaurants, sight seeing and the best way of getting to each. Overall, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel view to the Pendera house by Gaudi”
Reviews.Author: RubenHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Perdera Penthouse (8th floor) with a view to the Perdera Building by Antonio Gaudi. The hotel is a former office block rebuilt to a design apartment hotel, situated in the most expensive quarters of Barcelona. The Penthouse consists of a bedroom, living room, kitchen and bathroom with a large balcony facing the chick Paseo de Gracia. The living room is furnished with an elegant design sofa, not too comfortable. The beds are good, and the bathroom luxurious. Unfortunately design goes here before practicality too - the are no hooks to hang the towels on. You can have a modest breakfast in the cellar restaurant for 16 euros, but it requires an order the day before. The kitchen is sufficiently equipped with a fridge. The hotel is well kept and very tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all ways”
Reviews.Author: parag_parekh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and had a very good stay here. The hotel is well located and close to everything. Its a small hotel but beats the large ones in terms of amenities, design and service. The staff at the reception were both knowledgeable and helpful. They went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Apartments on 6th floor are best. Would stay again at next visit

Reviews.Title: “Every Apartment Permits Smoking in Avenue Suites”
Reviews.Author: Mary70124
Reviews.Content: I booked a Deluxe Pedrera View Apartment for 10 days and included a non-smoking request thru the Avenue Suites Derby hotels website. Website did not include the smoking policy and or options. My confirmation email included the following info: 63-m2 apartments with bedroom-suite, bedroom, sitting-dining room, fully equipped kitchen and full bathroom. The two bedrooms mean that the space set aside for rest can easily be combined with a possible workspace for those who need to combine both uses. Their private terraces are ideal for taking in the views over Paseo de Gracia and the Art Nouveau-style Pedrera building by Gaudí. Wireless Internet access (with charge) Views over Paseo de Gracia + the Pedrera Sitting-dining room 0.90 x 1.90 m sofa 0.85 x 1.50 m sofa Terrace 2 Flat-screen LCD TVs Ceramic hob Regrigerator Dishwasher Dinner service, cutlery and table linen Kitchen utensils Iron and ironing board Citrus press Toaster Individual heating and air-conditioning Satellite Television Direct phone line Safe Hairdryer Smoking is permitted in all apartments Complimentary toiletries Free baby cot on request if available "SMOKING IS PERMITTED IN ALL APARTMENTS" was an unfortunate surprise. I emailed the hotel and they emailed that they encourage people to smoke on their terraces...but I could cancel if that was a problem. I called the other Derby Hotel property Balmes Luxe and they told me they were a completely non-smoking property. Unfortunately they had no availability. I rebooked in another hotel with non smoking options. I would have saved allot of time if the website had mentioned their smoking policy. I would certainly recommend this hotel to all smokers. As I did not end up being able to stay there...I rated this hotel as it was reviewed by others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LucieAM
Reviews.Content: Booked this venue after thoroughly researching all options and we were not disappointed. This is a fantastic location for those wanting to explore Barcelona surrounded by the most exclusive stores and restaurants. The hotel itself is above Hugo Boss... We were lucky enough to receive an upgrade to the penthouse apartment which provides a stunning view of Predera. There is ample room and amenities for a city break. The staff were pleasant and helpful and when booking the room they ensured that nothing was too much trouble even arranging a bottle of cava in the room on arrival. The best way to explore Barcelona has got to be via a bus tour and there is conveniently a stop across the road from the hotel. Whilst we took note of the warnings regarding pick pockets we felt very safe in this area. We would certainly recommend Suites Avenue to those looking for a special city break!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: bucky71
Reviews.Content: Positives - Great location and very friendly front-desk staff. Downsides - despite booking the most expensive option - Pedrera View De-Luxe - we were given an apartment with a tiny (unusable) balcony, with an obscured view.Despite a complaint on the first night we were told that nothing else was available. On Easter Sunday morning we were awoken at 8.30 by loud hammering and drilling as flooring was broken up elsewhere in the building - this went on for most of the day. A unique feature of this class of establishment is that you are required to remove your own trash and take it to bins in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Suite - Suites Avenue”
Reviews.Author: ggfcress
Reviews.Content: This is our first time in Barcelona so we were thinking we should stay in a hotel so we could get guidance during our stay but we wanted 2 rooms. We saw great reviews for Suites Avenue and decided to give it a try. Hugo and Anna, the concierges, have been a wealth of information and every question has been answered with a smile (and the questions have been endless.) Check out the website - the rooms are beautiful, the roof provides amazing views, and the neighborhood is great. Suites Avenue is centrally located and very close to 2 subway stops and several buses. When you check out the price you'll be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, contemporary apartment , excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Lillybuttt
Reviews.Content: Suites Avenue Apartments are perfect for a a city break as they allow you to be situated in the centre of Barcelona within walking distance of all the major attractions. The apartments are stylish and modern with good quality fixtures and fittings. It is definately worth paying a bit extra for a view of 'La Pedrera', wow what a view!! We stayed in room 66 on the sixth floor and had a great 2 bedroomed apartment. We were really impressed with how easy it was to get from Barcelona Airport to the apartments. Simply buy a 'T10' ticket which costs around 8 euros and entitles you to 10 journeys on any form of transport in zone 1 (you can also share it between as many people as you like rather than having to buy one each as you would in London) The train takes aprox 30mins to get to the 'Passeig de Gràcia' where you need to get off, its literally 4 mins walk from there. The apartments are literally opposite La Pedrera which is a great point of reference. My only minor quibbles regarding the apartments (and they are minor) are that they don't provide you with bath robes as advertised and that there was no microwave or kettle. We had to boil water in a pan. The apartments all have a Nespresso machine but you have to buy the capsules at 1.5 euros a pop so my tip is to take your own. Loads of lovely places to eat and drink near by. We visited lovely places for breakfast and there is a mini supermarket a couple of blocks away to buy provisions from. All in all we loved Barcelona (if only the weather had been better). The Sagrada Família is breathtaking, i am not in the least religious and felt moved to tears at the beauty of the building. The Catalonian people are fantastic and very proud of their heritage. The only warning would be to be aware of your handbgs etc at all times as pickpocketing is a real problem, however we didn't experience any issues. Will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Best location, affordable and modern....we felt like we were in our own place”
Reviews.Author: SOBEBUNN
Reviews.Content: I found Suites Avenue through a vacation rental website. I was looking and looking for a well located, modern, affordable and comfortable place to stay for an extended stay of 10 days/nights. I almost booked at the Mandarin Oriental and then decided on Suites Avenue since it was on the same street and virtually 1/3 of the price. The staff was so accomidating from the second I arrived. I was arriving at a different time than my boyfriend so I was a little nervous about arriving alone but the location is 100% safe and the most exclusive street in Barcelona. Anna recieved me and checked me in with such ease and comfort. She spoke English and Spanish so it was easy to communicate my needs to her. When I got to the room I could not believe it, WOW it was exactly like the photos but even better. The view was great, we were in 725 and it was the best view in the best floor of the building under the PH facing La Pedrera and with amazing light. We had a small yet effective kitchen (where we cooked at least breakfast every morning). They had all of the items to cook with and so much more including wine and cava, sodas and beer. The Nespresso coffe machine was perfect addition and instead of paying for each one we went to the Nespresso store a few blocks away and bought some coffee inserts for the machine. Not a far walk and a very cool store too. The bathroom was perfect in size with a full shower and tub. A toilet and bidet and ultra modern slate and tiles with a modern sink....the bathroom products were given each day and smelled delightful!! The sinks and fixures were the brand name "Duravit" which are ultra modern. Whoever developed the building designed the closets and storage so well since there were at 4 closets total and much more space in the kitchen. A full washer/dryer are in the ktichen and made things much easier on us rather than going out to try to find someone to clean some socks (which my BF ran out of) The 1 bedroom was addequately sized and the queen bed was plenty big enough and comfortable for us. The sheets were changed daily and the only thing we didn't like was the silky and slippery duvet cover, although the color was nice the material had a kind of polyester feel. We just removed it from the down comforter. I wished that there would have been an extra comfy and soft blanket in the room but I never did ask for one. We spent so little time in the room and relaxing since there are so many things to do in this magical city. We are a younger couple who was there for a romantic getaway and it was quiet and so appropriate. We hardly ever saw or heard anyone in the building. It was serene yet you walked downstairs and you could hop in a cab anywhere for a reasonable amount of euro (under $10 euro) If you do not mind the METRO you are even better off with 3 stations within 5 minutes. The neighborhood is busy with lots of local professionals and tourists. BUT it is not a tourist trap like Las Ramblas where you cannot sleep at night, we slept like babies!!!! In the morning the sunrises were beautiful glowing a bright orange and looking out into the Gaudi Masterpeice across the street made it seem surreal being there. There is a small gym, pool (which the weather wasn't that warm to swim), and a rooftop terrace where you can sit and enjoy views all around the city. The views are breathtaking up there. We opened a bottle of cava and enjoyed! We were around great shopping, restaurants of all types, mercados ( markets) and there is a pharmacy directly across the street. An atm is right in the building of the Pedrera and easy to find. I am 100% satisfied with the Suties Avenue. I would not have wanted to stay anywhere else in the city. We enjoyed the location and it was so safe and the best value of any of the other hotels which I was looking at. Our room was around 60 sq meters, which is DOUBLE the average size of a hotel room in Barcelona. The building and apartment were so new that it felt like you were the first one using it. Oh I forgot to mention that the internet is free and they give you a cable to connect. If you want to connect wireless you obtain a code downstairs for a free 1 hour. We loved Suites Avenue and we loved BArcelona!! What a special city and the Suites Avenue is on the top of my list!!! Don't waste your $$$ at the other hotels. The staff Chubby and Anna were so pleasant and helped us with maps and directions all of the time. It was helpful to say the least. Go to Barca and see Suites Avenue...you will feel like you are living in a dream!!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary location and fantastic apartment”
Reviews.Author: Carlos0112
Reviews.Content: This apart-hotel is the place to stay if you are in a short vacation visiting Barcelona with one young kid. The location is the best to visit Barcelona, the apartment has a trendy and comfortable design, with two bathrooms and one kitchen. Staff is very kind and it is great value for money. I'm originally from Barcelona, so I know the city very well and this is probably the best for a couple with one young kid.

Reviews.Title: “lujo discreto”
Reviews.Author: philippe089
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Suites avenues last week-end.the location is exelent.The design of the hotel is amasing.from outside and inside! the .first night we stayed in an appartment facing the street,with a nice balcony,the second facing a large garden patio.Both appartment were very large,about 60- 70 m.the design is very nice.Kitchen fully equipted with a nice wine bar....the service is good and discret.no restaurant,but a lot of bars and restaurants around.The gym is basic.small pool. the place looks new .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic to have the space and facilities”
Reviews.Author: jhass1
Reviews.Content: With a baby of 19 months it was always going to be difficult to give Barcelona the full attention it deserves but having an apartment with a sompletely separate sitting room made it ossible to sit and have a glass of wine after the little one had gone to sleep. This is fabulusly situated and beautifully appointed. Clean, modern and fully functional. Everything you need for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience Easter Week 2010”
Reviews.Author: onecountryatatime
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of March / First week of April 2010. We had a Deluxe Apartment, La Predera View for 3 People on the 4th floor. The hotel is right across the street from Casa Mila and we had a 2 bedroom suite which overlooked Passeig de Gracia and this impressive Gaudi site. You are steps from the Diagonal Metro stop and the Passeig de Gracia stop is a little further down the block. It is an awesome part of town and you will feel totally safe walking around late at night. 15 minute walk down to the Las Ramblas area. There is a Caprabo gocery store about 5 min walk away. This was absolutely central to everything we did and everywhere we wanted to go. There are tons of restuarants and cafes to sit at. Chocolate shops, bakeries and yes.. fast food down the street (if you want it). Starbucks is right up the street a block away but I prefer the local coffee shops. The Hotel itself is gorgeous from the inside and out. Hardwood floors, minimalist decorations, clean lines. The 9th floor has an amazing terrace providing views from all over the city. Don't miss it. The hotel staff is very nice and can provide great tapas restuarant recommendations a few short minute walk away. There is no room service or restaurant and that suited us just fine. They do have a work out room on the 2nd floor along with a small pool. Ameneties Master Bedroom + Ensuite Full Bath, Single Bedroom + Ensuite Bath + Kitchen + Eating Area + Sitting Area + Balcony (no room to sit) Your own air conditioning/heating system. Safe in the master bedroom. See Details below: Kitchen: They expect you to keep the kitchen area clean. We had no issue with this. They do provide 1 small kit the first day of liquid soap, cloth, towel and a disherwasher cube. The kitchen has all the basics to pull together a meal. Toaster Washer/Dryer Combo (for clothes not cooking) Microwave/Oven Combo 4 burner cooktop glass Fridge/Freezer Wine Cooler Pots, Pans, Winer Opener, knives, tongs Hand Blender Nespresso machine (didn't use) We had 4 place settings, dishes, glasses and eating utensils Drinking glasses included: Wine, Champagne and Water. Bedrooms - we had two. We had 1 single Twin in one small bedroom Two Twins in the "Master" bedroom that could be separated into two beds. Housekeeping comes every day to clean up the rooms and provide fresh linens and bathroom towels. Bathrooms - we have two The showers are heaven. Big rain showerheads with lots of water pressure and hot water. The single bath was a little tight. Shower, Toilet and Sink. No where to place your things. The Master bath was very spacious and included Shower, Tub and Toilet in separate screened off section. Plenty of counter space. They provide 1 blow dryer as well. Provided are a towel for the floor, a hand towel and full size body towel. Bring your own wash cloth. We always do when traveling to Europe. They also provide you a small bathroom amenity kit with shampoo, conditioner, body wash. TV's We had 3 flat screens: Sitting area and one in each Bedroom. All Spanish channels. We enjoyed watching the local channels trying to make out the news! Closets Plenty of closet space and they provided a few hangers. Drinks: They do provide a couple bottles of wine, beer and water which they will charge you for. Go to the grocery!! Recommendations you should bring. Traveling with a hungry teenager we knew we would be eating some meals in the room. Food in the grocery stores is very reasonable. Spain has the most amazing bread, lunch meat (jamon) and cheeses! If you don't want to buy all this stuff, bring it with you. We did. It will save you time and money. Additional Liquid Detergent (put some in a small bottle). Additional Dishwasher Detergent (cascade or finish cubes). Additional sponge or Cloth to wash counters in the kitchen 1 roll of paper towels Napkins Paper plates, plastic glasses, plastic utensils (for morning breakfast). Salt and Pepper Spices if you want to cook with them. (put a small amount in a snack size baggie). Take some old rag towels for the kitchen area that you can leave. Ziploc Bags Foil Small Trash Bags. (We used our grocery store bags) Bar Soap for the bathroom Wash cloth for yourself (bathroom) Ice cube tray if you want ice cubes. (We wish we would have had them). Recommendations for the hotel. Would like a little more information in the hotel room. Example: to Dial 9 for reception Local amenities close by in the neighborhood Simple guide on how to use the appliances. We figured it out for the most part. The room must be "inspected" prior to departure. Would be nice if the hotel provided an "inventory" of what they had it in. (ie 3 TV's but only 2 remotes?) Would love it if they provided ice cube trays for the freezers. We hooked up our computer to their wireless (it was free for our room). Just ask for the code at reception. Being brand new...This hotel is fabulous. Would absolutely stay here again and highly recommend it. The rooms are so quiet. The perfect location for an amazing clean city with lots to do. Barcelona. A great place to spend a week.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: SignoraG
Reviews.Content: Fabulous, very cool, serviced apartments in one of the best streets of the city. We took 2 adjacent apartments for New Year 2010 and they suited our needs perfectly. Don't expect to cook gourmet meals in the kitchens but they are ideal for a few days' stay and have dishwasher, Nespresso machine and wine fridge. There is also a washer/dryer with iron etc and a hairdryer in the excellent bathroom. Good flat-screen TVs but no DVD player which seemed odd in accommodation of this quality. There is a fitness area, a panoramic roof terrace with loungers and a small, sheltered pool again with loungers which we imagined would be a real oasis in the summer months. If you want to be picky, soundproofing not perfect - you could hear upstairs toilet/bath water and considerate guests should use the slippers provided on the wooden/slate floors! We had a slight issue with an internal(electric) blind not closing and light coming in from the central atrium which they seemed unable to fix but all other small matters were sorted immediately. Great combination of the space given by an apartment and hotel service (ie daily cleaning etc.) Would definitely return.

HotelInfo.Name: Suites Avenue
HotelInfo.Address: Passeig de Gracia, 83, 8008 Barcelona, Spain
